docs.lead_paragraph: Wipe your finger across a tabletop that hasn't been cleaned for three days and, in some cities, you will pick up an amount of lead that is several times the safe daily dose for a child. Four percent of children under 5, and 18 percent of black children who live in inner cities, carry more than the safe burden of lead, accumulated from soil, air and household dust. After several actions that can only increase lead poisoning among children, the Reagan Administration is about to take an important step that will reduce the affliction.
